means: 路西塔尼亚（古罗马的一个省名，相当于现今葡萄牙的大部和西班牙西部的一部分）

sentence.Network_en: More than a thousand people died when the Lusitania was torpedoed.
sentence.Network_cn: 卢西塔尼亚号被鱼雷击沉，导致1，000多人死亡。

sentence.Network_en: Some consider McCays Sinking of the Lusitania from 1918 to be the first animated feature film.
sentence.Network_cn: 有人认为1918年麦凯的《露斯坦尼亚号之沉没》是世界上第一部动画电影.

sentence.Network_en: But the Lusitania took less than 20 minutes, and panic was the order of the day.
sentence.Network_cn: 但是露西塔尼亚号不到20分钟就沉?, 大家都慌了.

means.word_mean: 1. ancient region and Roman province of the Iberian peninsula; corresponds roughly to modern Portugal and parts of Spain

auth_sentence.content: One big difference between the Titanic and other wrecks the Lusitania, say is the way her story unfolded in real time.
